title: Inside the Duchy: What it’s really like to have Prince Charles as your landlord
text:
When the Prince of Wales popped in to visit young dairy farmers Kevin and Justyna Hughes, the circumstances were not exactly auspicious: they were living in an old caravan on their newly leased farm just outside Hereford. The weather was so cold, the water had frozen, precluding them from even offering him a cup of tea. Moreover, as soon as the Prince arrived, so did the snow.

“We were a little bit nervous,” says Kevin, 36, in his warm Welsh accent, “but he’s not what you expect. He didn’t mind at all. He came over to the yard to see the cows and have a look at our new milking parlour. He was so knowledgeable.”

“And when we met him at his 70th birthday party last year, he remembered everything...
description: When the Prince of Wales popped in to visit young dairy farmers Kevin and Justyna Hughes, the circumstances were not exactly auspicious:
